body.p: 7th and 8th Grade News By Dorothy Olsen Honor Rail The seventh grade has finished the study of the United States History and have tailed on a complete review. In Art they have completed a forest and garden landscape. The eighth grade has finished their Hygiene book and will begin on a re- view very soon. In Arithmetic we have finished equation and ratio and will login time and measurement. In Art they have finished a sketch of the "Leaning Tower of Pisa." In Agriculture we are studying gardening. Twelve students of the twenty-five in out room, play in the hand or have started on instruments. Several pupils are participating in the Grade Chorus under the direction of Miss Carmany. Last Friday our room attended the Dade Tournament In the gymnasium, Wittenberg defeated the Orphan Home but failed to receive any trophy in the Tournament.
